text.title: Be a Happy, Healthy Tween Girl
text.head: Be a Happy, Healthy Tween Girl
text.p: Lots of girls wonder: How can they be their very best while balancing school, hobbies, social life, and athletics? It can be challenging! This article can show you how to do all that and more!
text.head: Steps
Staying Healthy

list.item: Keep yourself hydrated. One of the most important parts of feeling and looking good is very simple; stay hydrated! Make sure to drink plenty of water, especially while outside or exercising. Make sure to drink at least eight full glasses a day. It not only keeps you looking bright and happy, but it makes you feel good, too!

Exercise. Exercise is vital to keeping a growing girl feeling refreshed. Whether it is riding a bike, running on a treadmill, doing push ups, walking the dog or dancing with a younger sibling, all forms help you to staying fit! If you are active and get at least 30 minutes of exercise a day, this is a great start. You may require even more, however. Some girls work outÂ because they want to lose weight. That is okay, as long as you do not over- exert yourself.
Talk to a parent first before trying to lose weight.

Eat right. Another important part to staying healthy is eating right! You should consume between five and thirteen serving of fruits and vegetables a day, that is equivalent to two and a half to six and a half cups daily.
Substitute beef for chicken and turkey and a bag of chips for an apple or some carrots.
If you eat dessert often, try to restrict consumption of high calorie sweets once a week.
Be careful not to over-eat or under-eat as this can be dangerous if done regularly. Make sure to have three meals every day.

text.head: Looking Your Best

list.item:
Keep your makeup natural. You are beautiful just the way you are. Do not forget that. Make sure to always make your makeup look natural and light, if you do decide to wear any at all. A little blush, concealer, lip gloss, and a light eye shadow is fine, but do not go to extremes with mascara, eyeliner, dark eye shadow, and lipstick.
Make sure the makeup you are wearing follow the rules approved by your parents, so as not to get in trouble.
Make sure to check your school's policy on makeup if you want to wear some to school. Some schools don't allow it.

Wear clothes that compliment your complexion. For example, if you are a blonde, try wearing colours that compliment you like red and purple. Brunettes will look stunning in red. If you have red or orange hair, wear forest green colors, as it will bring out your hair.

text.head: Having Good Hygiene

list.item: Remember that good hygiene can help you look and feel nicer. Make sure to shower or bathe every day if you can. Use a mild soap to wash off the day's dirt from your skin. Carefully wash and dry your face, hands, feet, armpits and bottom. Take a shower after you exercise or get sweaty to keep clean.

Smell good. Use body sprays that you like. Use deodorants if you like.
You can use perfume sometimes but it's usually best to keep it subtle don't overdo it.

text.head: Learning Good Behaviour

list.item: Learn to forgive. Gracefully distance yourself from those who back bite or bad mouth you.
Have healthy interactions. Get on social media so you can connect with your friends.

text.head: Tips

list.item: Shower every day. Try to wash your hair three times a week. Washing your hair every day has been proven to make hair thinner.

text.head: Warnings

list.item: Don't judge people if they seem inferior. Remember that you aren't perfect either.

Never miss out on meals frequently, over-exercise or make yourself throw up. These are all dangerous habits and are signs of having an eating disorder such as anorexia or bulimia. If you think you may have problems get help immediately.
It's fine to keep in touch with friends on social media but be aware of the dangers online and be safe.
